name: Ethiopian Yirgacheffe
tastingNotes: Bright citrus, floral jasmine, bergamot, and stone fruit with a tea-like body
bestFor: Pour over, drip coffee, those who enjoy fruity and floral profiles

name: Colombian Supremo
tastingNotes: Caramel sweetness, milk chocolate, roasted nuts, subtle red apple
bestFor: Espresso, French press, everyday drinking, those who prefer balanced flavors

name: Sumatra Mandheling
tastingNotes: Earthy, herbal, dark chocolate, cedar, with syrupy sweetness
bestFor: French press, cold brew, those who enjoy bold, earthy coffees with low acidity

name: Kenya AA
tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, grapefruit, tomato leaf, bright and winey finish
bestFor: V60 pour over, Chemex, those who love juicy, complex acidity

name: Guatemala Antigua
tastingNotes: Cocoa, baking spices, orange zest, rounded sweetness
bestFor: Drip coffee, espresso, balanced and sweet cups

name: Costa Rica Tarrazú
tastingNotes: Honey, citrus, red berry, crisp and clean finish
bestFor: Pour over, Aeropress, clarity-forward brews

name: Brazil Santos
origin: Minas Gerais and São Paulo, Brazil
tastingNotes: Nutty, milk chocolate, low acidity, creamy body
bestFor: Espresso, moka pot, crowd-pleasing blends

name: Tanzania Peaberry
tastingNotes: Citrus, black tea, melon, lively and bright
bestFor: Kalita Wave, manual brews with high clarity

name: Hawaiian Kona
tastingNotes: Sweet cream, light cocoa, tropical fruit, silky texture
bestFor: Drip, siphon, smooth and delicate cups

name: Jamaican Blue Mountain
tastingNotes: Sweet almond, mild chocolate, balanced and clean
bestFor: Filter coffee, those who prefer mild, refined profiles

name: Rwanda Bourbon
tastingNotes: Red currant, hibiscus, brown sugar, tea-like body
bestFor: Pour over, bringing out delicate florals and fruit

name: Burundi Kayanza
tastingNotes: Cranberry, maple, baking spice, clean and crisp
bestFor: Hand-brewed filter, bright yet sweet cups

name: Peru Chanchamayo
tastingNotes: Caramel, gentle citrus, walnut, soft finish
bestFor: Drip, batch brew, approachable daily drinker

name: Mexico Chiapas
tastingNotes: Cocoa nib, panela, orange peel, smooth body
bestFor: Espresso and milk drinks, balanced chocolate notes

name: Honduras Marcala
tastingNotes: Brown sugar, stone fruit, vanilla, gentle acidity
bestFor: Auto-drip, immersion, sweet and round profiles

name: Nicaragua Segovia
tastingNotes: Caramel, pear, cocoa, balanced and clean
bestFor: French press, drip, balanced cups

name: El Salvador Pacamara
tastingNotes: Red fruit, toffee, floral aromatics, creamy body
bestFor: Pour over, showcasing varietal clarity

name: Panama Geisha
tastingNotes: Jasmine, bergamot, tropical fruit, tea-like and luminous

name: Papua New Guinea
tastingNotes: Tropical fruit, molasses, herbal undertones, round body

name: India Monsooned Malabar
tastingNotes: Low acidity, earthy, cedar, spicy with heavy body

name: Yemen Mokha
tastingNotes: Cocoa, dried date, spice, winey complexity

name: Bolivia Caranavi
